title: Torque and work - block slowing wheel

content.question: A wheel with rotational inertia <math alttext="I" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>I</mi></math> and radius <math alttext="R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math> initially spins with angular speed <math alttext="omega sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>ω</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></mstyle></math>. A wooden block is pressed against the rim of the wheel, as shown. The block exerts a normal force of magnitude <math alttext="F sub N" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>F</mi><mi>N</mi></msub></math> on the rim of the wheel, causing the wheel to slow down to rest. The coefficient of kinetic friction between the wheel and the block is <math alttext="mu sub k" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>μ</mi><mi>k</mi></msub></mstyle></math>. Which of the following is equal to the angular displacement of the wheel as it slows down to rest?
